captions.text: This is their U18 FA Youth Cup team you’re playing today.
But like I’ve said to you before
we at times have come and got stuck against these type of teams.
And yet we stepped up a level against Man United,
and played their U21s to go and get a 1-1 draw.
You turn it on.
As a footballer, as a pro footballer, you have to turn it on every day.
Because you just don’t know who’s watching. You don’t know what’s around the corner.
It takes one good game and one good week’s trial,
for possibly a club to offer you an opportunity. That’s it.
Look, credit to you. You’re a durable group of boys.
Alan Irvine’s [Everton’s Academy Manager] just said, where are they from, you know.
I ain’t saying we’re gonna get a contract out of Everton.

But what you do is you come here and give yourselves
the best possible opportunity that you can of people saying,
"I tell you what, if you’re a lower league club, go and have a look at the Nike Academy."
Which is all we ask of you, which is all I ever ask of you.
Now, we have another game tomorrow.
And what I do know tomorrow is there are people coming to watch.
There are scouts there tomorrow.
So for me now, cos you’re all fit enough – you’re all fit enough – it’ll be mental.
